body: Hey there, did you install netlib from master as well? pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/mitmproxy/netlib.git Cheers, Max

no, I git cloned mitmproxy master and replaced my libmproxy files

just tried command that you wrote, and will look to logs. It can take a while, error occurs a few times a day

## here is  pip upgrade result, everything ok?

Successfully installed pyasn1 netlib

## Cleaning up...

Hey there,

your pip upgrade looks fine.

Thanks,
Max

You indicated that it occurs a few times a day - any particular patterns?
How much traffic is going through your proxy, particulary when the error occurs (requests/second)?

Thanks,
Max

is there any log option in libmproxy that I could switch on?

2013/7/21 Maximilian Hils notifications@github.com

> You indicated that it occurs a few times a day - any particular patterns?
> How much traffic is going through your proxy, particulary when the error
> occurs (requests/second)?
> 
> Thanks,
> Max

here is some traceback

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 530, in __bootstrap_inn                                                                                                  er
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/controller.py", lin                                                                                                  e 92, in run
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 365, in                                                                                                   serve_forever
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 200, in accept
error: [Errno 24] Too many open files

I'm trying to reproduce this using the current master, and there must be something different about our setups. Could you please take a look at the output for a command like this:

lsof -n -p PID

Where PID is the process ID of the mitmproxy process. This lists all the files that the process has open, including sockets. Could you take a look at this, and see if anything specific looks out of place. Are most of the open files sockets? Or are we leaking actual file pointers? How many open files are there in total?

Also, could you please let me know what your platform is. There are some small differences between platforms that could be contributing here.

issue.title: Too many open files error

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
Hi
I've had my libmproxy based server running for about a week and then it errors with:

Error in processing of request from 80.176.153.206:49325 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 353, in request_thread
    self.handle_connection(request, client_address)
  File "/home/staging/sslproxy/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 559, in handle_connection
    h.handle()
  File "/home/staging/sslproxy/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 189, in handle
    while self.handle_request(cc) and not cc.close:
  File "/home/staging/sslproxy/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 204, in handle_request
    request = self.read_request(cc)
  File "/home/staging/sslproxy/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 473, in read_request
    return self.read_request_transparent(client_conn)
  File "/home/staging/sslproxy/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 371, in read_request_transparent
    self.convert_to_ssl(dummycert, self.config.certfile or self.config.cacert, handle_sni=sni)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 289, in convert_to_ssl
    ctx.use_privatekey_file(key)
Error: [('system library', 'fopen', 'Too many open files'), ('BIO routines', 'FILE_CTRL', 'system lib'), ('SSL routines', 'SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file', 'system lib')]

This was a fresh install (with pip install) last week so I should be using the latest packages.

Any ideas?

Thanks
Adrian

body: I've just committed a patch that I believe fixes this issue. Please check out master, and re-open this bug if you still see the behaviour.

thanks

I did pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy.git

checked local proxy.py - path is there

tomorrow I will look at logs and say if patch helps

another error after patching:

---

Error in processing of request from 91.215.190.127:49607
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 356, in request_thread
    self.handle_connection(request, client_address)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 525, in handle_connection
    h.handle()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 193, in handle
    self.del_server_connection()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 183, in del_server_connection
    self.server_conn.terminate()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 87, in terminate
    self.wfile.flush()
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 97, in flush
    raise NetLibDisconnect(str(v))
NetLibDisconnect: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

---

system is CentOS x86_64
didnt found how to reopen issue

@dsultanr, 
@cortesi issued another patch for that (df3d2d7) - Please check out master again and comment on this issue if you still see the behaviour.

pip upgraded mitmproxy again

---

    self.handle_connection(request, client_address)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/libmproxy/proxy.py", line 525, in handle_connection

NetLibDisconnect: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

here is a part of my proxy.py

 84     def terminate(self):
 85         if self.connection:
 86             try:
 87                 self.wfile.flush()
 88             except IOError: # pragma: no cover
 89                 pass
 90             try:

Okay, I didn't take a closer look before assuming that @cortesi was tackling this issue with his commit - I'm pretty sure I just fixed it, feel free to try it again and comment if the error still occurs.

again

Error in processing of request from 213.248.63.189:49638
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/netlib/tcp.py", line 356, in request_thread
    self.handle_connection(request, client_address)

NetLibDisconnect: [Errno 32] Broken pipe

my proxy.py is:

76     def send(self, request):
 77         self.requestcount += 1
 78         d = request._assemble()
 79         if not d:
 80             raise ProxyError(502, "Cannot transmit an incomplete request.")
 81         self.wfile.write(d)
 82         self.wfile.flush()
 83
 84     def terminate(self):
 85         if self.connection:
 86             try:
 87                 self.wfile.flush()
 88             except IOError, tcp.NetLibDisconnect: # pragma: no cover
 89                 pass

 91                 self.connection.close()
 92             except IOError:
 93                 pass

 99         self.config, self.flow, self.channel = config, flow, controller.Channel(masterq)
100         threading.Thread.**init**(self)
